alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Sublette (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 22 at 6:11PM MDT until August 22 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Sublette County in west central Wyoming... Southwestern Fremont County in central Wyoming... * Until 700 PM MDT. * At 610 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from northeast of Pinedale to northeast of Big Sandy, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Dickinson Park around 620 PM MDT. Gannett Peak around 625 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Bull Lake, Fort Washakie, Crowheart, Ethete, Diversion Dam Rest Area, Torrey Lake, Kinnear, Morton and Pilot Butte Reservoir. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
